content.para: This document outlines the definitions of various fields used within the wiring data structure. It details the attributes and their meanings for standard parts used in wiring harnesses.
content.heading: Wiring Fields
Standard Part Group
content.para: This section describes the standard parts used and their attributes.
content.heading: Conduit

item.def: The unique identifier for the conduit.
An alternative identifier for the same conduit.
The code identifying the manufacturer of the conduit.
The physical size of the conduit.
The weight of the conduit.
The color of the conduit.
The thickness of the conduit's wall.
The lowest operating temperature the conduit can withstand.
The highest operating temperature the conduit can withstand.
Reference to a document containing a more detailed functional description.
Reference to a document containing an illustration of the conduit.

content.heading: Ident Sleeve (Identification Sleeve)

item.def: The unique identifier for the identification sleeve.
An alternative identifier for the same identification sleeve.
The code identifying the manufacturer of the identification sleeve.
The length of the identification sleeve.
The material the identification sleeve is made from.
The weight of the identification sleeve.
Reference to a document containing a more detailed functional description.
Reference to a document containing an illustration of the identification sleeve.

content.heading: Wire Material

item.def: The unique identifier for the wire material.
An alternative identifier for the same wire material.
The code identifying the manufacturer of the wire material.
The type of wire (e.g., stranded, solid).
The gauge of the wire.
The number of conductors within the wire.
The physical size of the wire.
The weight of the wire per unit length.
The color of the wire insulation.
The color of the outer jacket (if applicable).
The overall diameter of the wire.
The direct current resistance of the wire.
The maximum operating voltage.
The maximum current carrying capacity.
The lowest operating temperature.
The highest operating temperature.
The number of shields or screens.
Indicates if the wire is a coaxial cable.
Indicates if the wire is a tri-axial cable.
The AC impedance of the wire (typically for cables).
The frequency at which impedance or attenuation are measured.
The signal loss per unit length at a given frequency.
Reference to a document containing a more detailed functional description.
Reference to a document containing an illustration of the wire material.

content.heading: Conduit

item.def: The unique identifier for the conduit.
An alternative identifier for the same conduit.
The code identifying the manufacturer of the conduit.
The physical size of the conduit.
The weight of the conduit.
The color of the conduit.
The thickness of the conduit's wall.
The lowest operating temperature the conduit can withstand.
The highest operating temperature the conduit can withstand.
Reference to a document containing a more detailed functional description.
Reference to a document containing an illustration of the conduit.
